Load nifc_suppression_costs.tsv and nifc_human_caused_acres.tsv into separate dataframes.
Data cleaning: remove formatting characters (commas, dollar signs) from the 'Total’ columns in each file and convert the cleaned strings to numeric floats.
Join the two tables on the shared Year column so each year has both its acres and suppression costs.
Compute a new column cost_per_acre by dividing cleaned yearly suppression cost by acres burned.
Locate the row with the maximum value in cost_per_acre to determine which year had the highest suppression cost per acre.
Print that year along with the cost_per_acre rounded to two decimal places.
